definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: An old women found out a empty bottle which had ever been filled the best wine .
sentences.chinese: 一个老太婆找到一个不久前曾装过最好陈酒的空酒瓶。

sentences.english: The old lady at the desk leered at her knowingly.
sentences.chinese: 办公桌旁的老太婆会心地斜睨了她一眼。

sentences.english: The carline is fond of prying into others's things.
sentences.chinese: 这位老太婆爱打听别人家的事。

sentences.english: “I gave it to a poor old woman, ” he answered.
sentences.chinese: “我给了一个可怜的老太婆，”他回答说。

sentences.english: An old woman came along the road leaning on her staff.
sentences.chinese: 有一个老太婆拄着手杖沿路走过来。

sentences.english: The old woman's eyes were bedimmed with sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 这老太婆的双眼蒙上了一层悲愁。

sentences.english: The old lady climbed up the stairs with difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 这位老太婆艰难地爬上楼梯。

sentences.english: She recommended her baby to the care of an old woman.
sentences.chinese: 她把婴儿托付给一位老太婆照管。

sentences.english: The old woman rambled on about her misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 这位老太婆谈起她的不幸遭遇东拉西扯地说个没完。

sentences.english: He had a new woman tub.
sentences.chinese: 老太婆果然有了一只新木盆。

sentences.english: "You weren't looking for a little old lady, " said Gussie .
sentences.chinese: “你根本就没在找一个小老太婆，”格西说。

sentences.english: The old woman stood facing him in silence and looking inquiringly at him.
sentences.chinese: 老太婆默默地站在他面前，疑问地注视着他。

sentences.english: The old woman doddered from the bed to the table.
sentences.chinese: 老太婆从床边起身摇摇晃晃地向桌子走去。

sentences.english: The carline always pokes her nose into other family.
sentences.chinese: 这位老太婆爱打听别人家的事。

sentences.english: As if I were a doddering old relic.
sentences.chinese: 使我不再像那个蹒跚的老太婆。

sentences.english: What the devil am I to write to that good old soul?
sentences.chinese: 我得对她写些什么鬼话呢，对那个好老太婆？

definition: (coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
(derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
my old mother/I, this old woman/my old lady (colloquial)/maternal grandmother/midwife
grandpa (polite form of address for old man)
devil/You devil! (as joke or insult)/the departed
